The beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ, the Son of God.
undefined As it is written in Isaiah the prophet, “Look, I am sending my messenger ahead of you,who will prepare your way,
undefined the voice of one shouting in the wilderness,‘Prepare the way for the Lord,make his paths straight.’”
undefined In the wilderness John the baptizer be-gan preaching a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.
undefined People from the whole Judean countryside and all of Jerusalem were going out to him, and he was baptizing them in the Jordan River as they confessed their sins.
undefined John wore a garment made of camel’s hair with a leather belt around his waist, and he ate locusts and wild honey.
undefined He proclaimed, “One more powerful than I am is coming after me; I am not worthy to bend down and untie the strap of his sandals.
undefined I baptize you with water, but he will baptize you with the Holy Spirit.”The Baptism and Temptation of Jesus
undefined Now in those days Jesus came from Nazareth in Galilee and was baptized by John in the Jordan River.
undefined And just as Jesus was coming up out of the water, he saw the heav-ens splitting apart and the Spirit descending on him like a dove.
undefined And a voice came from heaven: “You are my one dear Son; in you I take great delight.”
undefined The Spirit immediate-ly drove him into the wilderness.
undefined He was in the wilderness forty days, enduring tempta-tions from Satan. He was with wild animals, and angels were ministering to his needs.Preaching in Galilee and the Call of the Disciples
undefined Now after John was imprisoned, Jesus went into Galilee and proclaimed the gospel of God.
undefined He said, “The time is fulfilled and the kingdom of God is near. Repent and be-lieve the gospel!”
undefined As he went along the Sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and Andrew, Simon’s brother, casting a net into the sea (for they were fishermen).
undefined Jesus said to them, “Follow me, and I will turn you into fishers of people.”
undefined They left their nets immediately and followed him.
undefined Going on a little far-ther, he saw James, the son of Zebedee, and John his brother in their boat mending nets.
undefined Immediately he called them, and they left their father Zebedee in the boat with the hired men and followed him.Jesus’ Authority
undefined Then they went to Capernaum. When the Sabbath came, Jesus went into the syna-gogue and began to teach.
undefined The people there were amazed by his teaching, because he taught them like one who had authority, not like the experts in the law.
undefined Just then there was a man in their synagogue with an unclean spirit, and he cried out,
undefined “Leave us alone, Jesus the Nazarene! Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are – the Holy One of God!”
undefined But Jesus rebuked him: “Silence! Come out of him!”
undefined After throwing him into convulsions, the unclean spirit cried out with a loud voice and came out of him.
undefined They were all amazed so that they asked each other, “What is this? A new teaching with authority! He even commands the unclean spirits and they obey him.”
undefined So the news about him spread quickly throughout all the region around Galilee.Healings at Simon’s House
undefined Now as soon as they left the syna-gogue, they entered Simon and Andrew’s house, with James and John.
undefined Simon’s mother-in-law was lying down, sick with a fever, so they spoke to Jesus at once about her.
undefined He came and raised her up by gently tak-ing her hand. Then the fever left her and she began to serve them.
undefined When it was even-ing, after sunset, they brought to him all who were sick and demon-possessed.
undefined The whole town gathered by the door.
undefined So he healed many who were sick with various dis-eases and drove out many demons. But he would not permit the demons to speak, be-cause they knew him.Praying and Preaching
undefined Then Jesus got up early in the morning when it was still very dark, departed, and went out to a deserted place, and there he spent time in prayer.
undefined Simon and his com-panions searched for him.
undefined When they found him, they said, “Everyone is looking for you.”
undefined He replied, “Let us go elsewhere, into the surrounding villages, so that I can preach there too. For that is what I came out here to do.”
undefined So he went into all of Galilee preaching in their synagogues and casting out demons.Cleansing a Leper
undefined Now a leper came to him and fell to his knees, asking for help. “If you are willing, you can make me clean,” he said.
undefined Moved with compassion, Jesus stretched out his hand and touched him, saying, “I am willing. Be clean!”
undefined The leprosy left him at once, and he was clean.
undefined Immediately Jesus sent the man away with a very strong warning.
undefined He told him, “See that you do not say anything to anyone, but go, show yourself to a priest, and bring the offering that Moses commanded for your cleansing, as a testimony to them.”

undefined But as the man went out he began to announce it publicly and spread the story widely, so that Jesus was no longer able to enter any town openly but stayed outside in remote places. 	Still they kept coming to him from every-where.Healing and Forgiving a Paralytic
Now after some days, when he re-turned to Capernaum, the news spread that he was at home.
undefined So many gathered that there was no longer any room, not even by the door, and he preached the word to them.
undefined Some people came bringing to him a paralytic, car-ried by four of them.
undefined When they were not able to bring him in because of the crowd, they removed the roof above Jesus. Then, after tearing it out, they lowered the stretcher the paralytic was lying on.
undefined When Jesus saw their faith, he said to the paralytic, “Son, your sins are forgiven.”
undefined Now some of the ex-perts in the law were sitting there, turning these things over in their minds:
undefined “Why does this man speak this way? He is blasphem-ing! Who can forgive sins but God alone?”
undefined Now immediately, when Jesus realized in his spirit that they were contemplating such thoughts, he said to them, “Why are you think-ing such things in your hearts?
undefined Which is easier, to say to the paralytic, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Stand up, take your stretcher, and walk’?
undefined But so that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins,” – he said to the paralytic –
undefined “I tell you, stand up, take your stretcher, and go home.”

undefined And immediately the man stood up, took his stretcher, and went out in front of them all. They were all amazed and glorified God, saying, “We have never seen anything like this!”The Call of Levi; Eating with Sinners
undefined Jesus went out again by the sea. The whole crowd came to him, and he taught them.
undefined As he went along, he saw Levi, the son of Alphaeus, sitting at the tax booth. “Fol-low me,” he said to him. And he got up and followed him.
undefined As Jesus was having a meal in Levi’s home, many tax collectors and sin-ners were eating with Jesus and his disciples, for there were many who followed him.
undefined When the experts in the law and the Pharisees saw that he was eating with sinners and tax collectors, they said to his disciples, “Why does he eat with tax collectors and sinners?”

undefined When Jesus heard this he said to them, “Those who are healthy don’t need a physi-cian, but those who are sick do. I have not come to call the righteous, but sinners.”The Superiority of the New
undefined Now John’s disciples and the Phari-sees were fasting. So they came to Jesus and said, “Why do the disciples of John and the disciples of the Pharisees fast, but your disci-ples don’t fast?”
undefined Jesus said to them, “The wedding guests cannot fast while the bride-groom is with them, can they? As long as they have the bridegroom with them they do not fast.
undefined But the days are coming when the bridegroom will be taken from them, and at that time they will fast.
undefined No one sews a patch of unshrunk cloth on an old garment; otherwise, the patch pulls away from it, the new from the old, and the tear becomes worse.

undefined And no one pours new wine into old wineskins; otherwise, the wine will burst the skins, and both the wine and the skins will be destroyed. Instead new wine is poured into new wineskins.”Lord of the Sabbath
undefined Jesus was going through the grain fields on a Sabbath, and his disciples began to pick some heads of wheat as they made their way.
undefined So the Pharisees said to him, “Look, why are they doing what is against the law on the Sabbath?”
undefined He said to them, “Have you never read what David did when he was in need and he and his companions were hun-gry –
undefined how he entered the house of God when Abiathar was high priest and ate the sacred bread, which is against the law for any but the priests to eat, and also gave it to his companions?”
undefined Then he said to them, “The Sabbath was made for people, not people for the Sabbath.
undefined For this reason the Son of Man is lord even of the Sabbath.”Healing a Withered Hand
Then Jesus entered the synagogue again, and a man was there who had a with-ered hand.
undefined They watched Jesus closely to see if he would heal him on the Sabbath, so that they could accuse him.
undefined So he said to the man who had the withered hand, “Stand up among all these people.”
undefined Then he said to them, “Is it lawful to do good on the Sabbath, or evil, to save a life or destroy it?” But they were silent.
undefined After looking around at them in anger, grieved by the hardness of their hearts, he said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” He stretched it out, and his hand was restored.
undefined So the Pharisees went out imme-diately and began plotting with the Herodians, as to how they could assassinate him.Crowds by the Sea
undefined Then Jesus went away with his disci-ples to the sea, and a great multitude from Galilee followed him. And from Judea,
undefined Jerusalem, Idumea, beyond the Jordan River, and around Tyre and Sidon a great multitude came to him when they heard about the things he had done.
undefined Because of the crowd, he told his disciples to have a small boat ready for him so the crowd would not press toward him.
undefined For he had healed many, so that all who were afflicted with diseases pressed toward him in order to touch him.
undefined And whenever the unclean spirits saw him, they fell down before him and cried out, “You are the Son of God.”
undefined But he sternly ordered them not to make him known.Appointing the Twelve Apostles
undefined Now Jesus went up the mountain and called for those he wanted, and they came to him.
undefined He appointed twelve (whom he named apostles), so that they would be with him and he could send them to preach
undefined and to have authority to cast out demons.
undefined He appointed twelve: To Simon he gave the name Peter;
undefined to James and his brother John, the sons of Zebedee, he gave the name Boanerges (that is, “sons of thunder”);
undefined and Andrew, Philip, Bartholomew, Matthew, Thomas, James the son of Alphaeus, Thaddae-us, Simon the Zealot,
undefined and Judas Iscariot, who betrayed him.Jesus and Beelzebul
undefined Now Jesus went home, and a crowd gathered so that they were not able to eat.
undefined When his family heard this they went out to restrain him, for they said, “He is out of his mind.”
undefined The experts in the law who came down from Jerusalem said, “He is possessed by Beelzebul,” and, “By the ruler of demons he casts out demons.”
undefined So he called them and spoke to them in parables: “How can Sa-tan cast out Satan?
undefined If a kingdom is divid-ed against itself, that kingdom will not be able to stand.
undefined If a house is divided against itself, that house will not be able to stand.
undefined And if Satan rises against himself and is di-vided, he is not able to stand and his end has come.
undefined But no one is able to enter a strong man’s house and steal his property unless he first ties up the strong man. Then he can thor-oughly plunder his house.
undefined I tell you the truth, people will be forgiven for all sins, even all the blasphemies they utter.
undefined But who-ever blasphemes against the Holy Spirit will never be forgiven, but is guilty of an eternal sin”
undefined (because they said, “He has an un-clean spirit”).Jesus’ True Family
undefined Then Jesus’ mother and his brothers came. Standing outside, they sent word to him, to summon him.
undefined A crowd was sitting around him and they said to him, “Look, your mother and your brothers are outside looking for you.”
undefined He answered them and said, “Who are my mother and my brothers?”
undefined And looking at those who were sitting around him in a circle, he said, “Here are my mother and my brothers!
undefined For whoever does the will of God is my brother and sister and moth-er.”The Parable of the Sower
Again he began to teach by the lake. Such a large crowd gathered around him that he got into a boat on the lake and sat there while the whole crowd was on the shore by the lake.
undefined He taught them many things in parables, and in his teaching said to them:
undefined “Listen! A sower went out to sow.
undefined And as he sowed, some seed fell along the path, and the birds came and devoured it.
undefined Other seed fell on rocky ground where it did not have much soil. It sprang up at once because the soil was not deep.
undefined When the sun came up it was scorched, and because it did not have sufficient root, it withered.
undefined Other seed fell among the thorns, and they grew up and choked it, and it did not produce grain.
undefined But other seed fell on good soil and produced grain, sprouting and growing; some yielded thirty times as much, some sixty, and some a hundred times.”
undefined And he said, “Whoever has ears to hear had better listen!”The Purpose of Parables
undefined When he was alone, those around him with the twelve asked him about the parables.
undefined He said to them, “The secret of the king-dom of God has been given to you. But to those outside, everything is in parables,
undefined so that although they look they may look but not see,and although they hear they may hear but not understand,so they may not repent and be forgiven.”
undefined He said to them, “Don’t you under-stand this parable? Then how will you under-stand any parable?
undefined The sower sows the word.
undefined These are the ones on the path where the word is sown: Whenever they hear, immediately Satan comes and snatches the word that was sown in them.
undefined These are the ones sown on rocky ground: As soon as they hear the word, they receive it with joy.
undefined But they have no root in themselves and do not endure. Then, when trouble or persecu-tion comes because of the word, immediately they fall away.
undefined Others are the ones sown among thorns: They are those who hear the word,
undefined but worldly cares, the seductive-ness of wealth, and the desire for other things come in and choke the word, and it produces nothing.
undefined But these are the ones sown on good soil: They hear the word and receive it and bear fruit, one thirty times as much, one sixty, and one a hundred.”The Parable of the Lamp
undefined He also said to them, “A lamp isn’t brought to be put under a basket or under a bed, is it? Isn’t it to be placed on a lampstand?
undefined For nothing is hidden except to be re-vealed, and nothing concealed except to be brought to light.
undefined If anyone has ears to hear, he had better listen!”
undefined And he said to them, “Take care about what you hear. The measure you use will be the measure you re-ceive, and more will be added to you.
undefined For whoever has will be given more, but whoever does not have, even what he has will be taken from him.”The Parable of the Growing Seed
undefined He also said, “The kingdom of God is like someone who spreads seed on the ground.
undefined He goes to sleep and gets up, night and day, and the seed sprouts and grows, though he does not know how.
undefined By itself the soil produces a crop, first the stalk, then the head, then the full grain in the head.
undefined And when the grain is ripe, he sends in the sickle because the harvest has come.”The Parable of the Mustard Seed
undefined He also asked, “To what can we com-pare the kingdom of God, or what parable can we use to present it?
undefined It is like a mustard seed that when sown in the ground, even though it is the smallest of all the seeds in the ground –
undefined when it is sown, it grows up, becomes the greatest of all garden plants, and grows large branches so that the wild birds can nest in its shade.”The Use of Parables
undefined So with many parables like these, he spoke the word to them, as they were able to hear.
undefined He did not speak to them without a parable. But privately he explained everything to his own disciples.Stilling of a Storm
undefined On that day, when evening came, Je-sus said to his disciples, “Let’s go across to the other side of the lake.”
undefined So after leaving the crowd, they took him along, just as he was, in the boat, and other boats were with him.
undefined Now a great windstorm developed and the waves were breaking into the boat, so that the boat was nearly swamped.
undefined But he was in the stern, sleeping on a cushion. They woke him up and said to him, “Teacher, don’t you care that we are about to die?”
undefined So he got up and rebuked the wind, and said to the sea, “Be quiet! Calm down!” Then the wind stopped, and it was dead calm.
undefined And he said to them, “Why are you cowardly? Do you still not have faith?”
undefined They were over-whelmed by fear and said to one another, “Who then is this? Even the wind and sea obey him!”Healing of a Demoniac
So they came to the other side of the lake, to the region of the Gerasenes.
undefined Just as Jesus was getting out of the boat, a man with an unclean spirit came from the tombs and met him.
undefined He lived among the tombs, and no one could bind him anymore, not even with a chain.
undefined For his hands and feet had often been bound with chains and shackles, but he had torn the chains apart and broken the shackles in pieces. No one was strong enough to subdue him.
undefined Each night and every day among the tombs and in the mountains, he would cry out and cut himself with stones.
undefined When he saw Jesus from a distance, he ran and bowed down before him.
undefined Then he cried out with a loud voice, “Leave me alone, Jesus, Son of the Most High God! I implore you by God – do not torment me!”
undefined (For Jesus had said to him, “Come out of that man, you unclean spirit!”)
undefined Jesus asked him, “What is your name?” And he said, “My name is Legion, for we are many.”
undefined He begged Jesus repeated-ly not to send them out of the region.
undefined There on the hillside, a great herd of pigs was feeding.
undefined And the demonic spirits begged him, “Send us into the pigs. Let us enter them.”
undefined Jesus gave them permission. So the unclean spirits came out and went into the pigs. Then the herd rushed down the steep slope into the lake, and about two thousand were drowned in the lake.
undefined Now the herdsmen ran off and spread the news in the town and countryside, and the people went out to see what had happened.
undefined They came to Jesus and saw the demon-possessed man sitting there, clothed and in his right mind – the one who had the “Legion” – and they were afraid.
undefined Those who had seen what had happened to the demon-possessed man reported it, and they also told about the pigs.
undefined Then they asked Jesus to leave their region.
undefined As he was getting into the boat the man who had been demon-possessed asked if he could go with him.
undefined But Jesus did not permit him to do so. Instead, he said to him, “Go to your home and to your people and tell them what the Lord has done for you, that he had mercy on you.”
undefined So he went away and began to proclaim in the Decapolis what Jesus had done for him, and all were amazed.Restoration and Healing
undefined When Jesus had crossed again in a boat to the other side, a large crowd gathered around him, and he was by the sea.
undefined Then one of the synagogue rulers, named Jairus, came up, and when he saw Jesus, he fell at his feet.
undefined He asked him urgently, “My little daughter is near death. Come and lay your hands on her so that she may be healed and live.”
undefined Jesus went with him, and a large crowd followed and pressed around him.
undefined Now a woman was there who had been suffering from a hemorrhage for twelve years.
undefined She had endured a great deal under the care of many doctors and had spent all that she had. Yet instead of getting better, she grew worse.
undefined When she heard about Jesus, she came up behind him in the crowd and touched his cloak,
undefined for she kept saying, “If only I touch his clothes, I will be healed.”
undefined At once the bleeding stopped, and she felt in her body that she was healed of her disease.
undefined Jesus knew at once that power had gone out from him. He turned around in the crowd and said, “Who touched my clothes?”
undefined His disciples said to him, “You see the crowd pressing against you and you say, ‘Who touched me?’”
undefined But he looked around to see who had done it.
undefined Then the woman, with fear and trembling, knowing what had happened to her, came and fell down before him and told him the whole truth.
undefined He said to her, “Daughter, your faith has made you well. Go in peace, and be healed of your dis-ease.”
undefined While he was still speaking, people came from the synagogue ruler’s house saying, “Your daughter has died. Why trouble the teacher any longer?”
undefined But Jesus, paying no attention to what was said, told the synagogue ruler, “Do not be afraid; just believe.”
undefined He did not let anyone follow him except Peter, James, and John, the brother of James.
undefined They came to the house of the synagogue ruler where he saw noisy confusion and people weeping and wailing loudly.
undefined When he entered he said to them, “Why are you dis-tressed and weeping? The child is not dead but asleep.”
undefined And they began making fun of him. But he put them all outside and he took the child’s father and mother and his own companions and went into the room where the child was.
undefined Then, gently taking the child by the hand, he said to her, “Talitha koum,” which means, “Little girl, I say to you, get up.”
undefined The girl got up at once and began to walk around (she was twelve years old). They were completely astonished at this.
undefined He strictly ordered that no one should know about this, and told them to give her something to eat.Rejection at Nazareth
Now Jesus left that place and came to his hometown, and his disciples followed him.

undefined When the Sabbath came, he began to teach in the synagogue. Many who heard him were astonished, saying, “Where did he get these ideas? And what is this wisdom that has been given to him? What are these miracles that are done through his hands?
undefined Isn’t this the car-penter, the son of Mary and brother of James, Joses, Judas, and Simon? And aren’t his sisters here with us?” And so they took offense at him.
undefined Then Jesus said to them, “A prophet is not without honor except in his hometown, and among his relatives, and in his own house.”
undefined He was not able to do a miracle there, except to lay his hands on a few sick people and heal them.
undefined And he was amazed because of their unbelief. Then he went around among the villages and taught.Sending Out the Twelve Apostles
undefined Jesus called the twelve and began to send them out two by two. He gave them au-thority over the unclean spirits.
undefined He in-structed them to take nothing for the journey except a staff – no bread, no bag, no money in their belts –
undefined and to put on sandals but not to wear two tunics.
undefined He said to them, “Wherever you enter a house, stay there until you leave the area.
undefined If a place will not wel-come you or listen to you, as you go out from there, shake the dust off your feet as a testi-mony against them.”
undefined So they went out and preached that all should repent.
undefined They cast out many demons and anointed many sick people with oil and healed them.The Death of John the Baptist
undefined Now King Herod heard this, for Je-sus’ name had become known. Some were saying, “John the baptizer has been raised from the dead, and because of this, miraculous powers are at work in him.”
undefined Others said, “He is Elijah.” Others said, “He is a prophet, like one of the prophets from the past.”
undefined But when Herod heard this, he said, “John, whom I beheaded, has been raised!”
undefined For Herod himself had sent men, arrested John, and bound him in prison on account of Hero-dias, his brother Philip’s wife, because Herod had married her.
undefined For John had repeatedly told Herod, “It is not lawful for you to have your brother’s wife.”
undefined So Herodias nursed a grudge against him and wanted to kill him. But she could not

undefined because Herod stood in awe of John and protected him, since he knew that John was a righteous and holy man. When Herod heard him, he was thoroughly baffled, and yet he liked to listen to John.
undefined But a suitable day came, when Herod gave a banquet on his birthday for his court officials, military commanders, and leaders of Galilee.
undefined When his daughter Herodias came in and danced, she pleased Herod and his dinner guests. The king said to the girl, “Ask me for whatever you want and I will give it to you.”
undefined He swore to her, “What-ever you ask I will give you, up to half my kingdom.”
undefined So she went out and said to her mother, “What should I ask for?” Her mother said, “The head of John the baptizer.”
undefined Immediately she hurried back to the king and made her request: “I want the head of John the Baptist on a platter immediately.”
undefined Although it grieved the king deeply, he did not want to reject her request because of his oath and his guests.
undefined So the king sent an executioner at once to bring John’s head, and he went and beheaded John in prison.
undefined He brought his head on a platter and gave it to the girl, and the girl gave it to her mother.
undefined When John’s disciples heard this, they came and took his body and placed it in a tomb.The Feeding of the Five Thousand
undefined Then the apostles gathered around Je-sus and told him everything they had done and taught.
undefined He said to them, “Come with me privately to an isolated place and rest a while” (for many were coming and going, and there was no time to eat).
undefined So they went away by themselves in a boat to some remote place.
undefined But many saw them leaving and recognized them, and they hurried on foot from all the towns and arrived there ahead of them.
undefined As Jesus came ashore he saw the large crowd and he had compassion on them, because they were like sheep without a shep-herd. So he taught them many things.
undefined When it was already late, his disciples came to him and said, “This is an isolated place and it is already very late.
undefined Send them away so that they can go into the sur-rounding countryside and villages and buy something for themselves to eat.”
undefined But he answered them, “You give them something to eat.” And they said, “Should we go and buy bread for two hundred silver coins and give it to them to eat?”
undefined He said to them, “How many loaves do you have? Go and see.” When they found out, they said, “Five – and two fish.”
undefined Then he directed them all to sit down in groups on the green grass.
undefined So they reclined in groups of hundreds and fif-ties.

undefined He took the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up to heaven, he gave thanks and broke the loaves. He gave them to his disciples to serve the people, and he divided the two fish among them all.
undefined They all ate and were satisfied,
undefined and they picked up the broken pieces and fish that were left over, twelve baskets full.
undefined Now there were five thousand men who ate the bread.Walking on Water
undefined Immediately Jesus made his disciples get into the boat and go on ahead to the other side, to Bethsaida, while he dispersed the crowd.
undefined After saying good-bye to them, he went to the mountain to pray.
undefined When even-ing came, the boat was in the middle of the sea and he was alone on the land.
undefined He saw them straining at the oars, because the wind was against them. As the night was ending, he came to them walking on the sea, for he want-ed to pass by them.
undefined When they saw him walking on the water they thought he was a ghost. They cried out,
undefined for they all saw him and were terrified. But immediately he spoke to them: “Have courage! It is I. Do not be afraid.”
undefined Then he went up with them into the boat, and the wind ceased. They were completely astonished,
undefined because they did not understand about the loaves, but their hearts were hardened.Healing the Sick
undefined After they had crossed over, they came to land at Gennesaret and anchored there.
undefined As they got out of the boat, people immediately recognized Jesus.
undefined They ran through that whole region and began to bring the sick on mats to wherever he was rumored to be.

undefined And wherever he would go – into villages, towns, or countryside – they would place the sick in the marketplaces, and would ask him if they could just touch the edge of his cloak, and all who touched it were healed.Breaking Human Traditions
Now the Pharisees and some of the ex-perts in the law who came from Jerusalem gathered around him.
undefined And they saw that some of Jesus’ disciples ate their bread with unclean hands, that is, unwashed.
undefined (For the Pharisees and all the Jews do not eat unless they perform a ritual washing, holding fast to the tradition of the elders.
undefined And when they come from the marketplace, they do not eat unless they wash. They hold fast to many oth-er traditions: the washing of cups, pots, ket-tles, and dining couches.)
undefined The Pharisees and the experts in the law asked him, “Why do your disciples not live according to the tradi-tion of the elders, but eat with unwashed hands?”
undefined He said to them, “Isaiah prophe-sied correctly about you hypocrites, as it is written:‘This people honors me with their lips,but their heart is far from me.
undefined They worship me in vain,teaching as doctrine the commandments of men.’
undefined Having no regard for the command of God, you hold fast to human tradition.”
undefined He also said to them, “You neatly reject the commandment of God in order to set up your tradition.
undefined For Moses said, ‘Honor your father and your mother,’ and, ‘Whoever in-sults his father or mother must be put to death.’
undefined But you say that if anyone tells his father or mother, ‘Whatever help you would have received from me is corban’ (that is, a gift for God),
undefined then you no longer permit him to do anything for his father or mother.
undefined Thus you nullify the word of God by your tradition that you have handed down. And you do many things like this.”
undefined Then he called the crowd again and said to them, “Listen to me, everyone, and understand.
undefined There is nothing outside of a person that can defile him by going into him. Rather, it is what comes out of a person that defiles him.”
undefined Now when Jesus had left the crowd and entered the house, his disciples asked him about the parable.
undefined He said to them, “Are you so foolish? Don’t you understand that whatever goes into a person from outside can-not defile him?
undefined For it does not enter his heart but his stomach, and then goes out into the sewer.” (This means all foods are clean.)
undefined He said, “What comes out of a person defiles him.
undefined For from within, out of the human heart, come evil ideas, sexual immorali-ty, theft, murder,
undefined adultery, greed, evil, deceit, debauchery, envy, slander, pride, and folly.
undefined All these evils come from within and defile a person.”A Syrophoenician Woman’s Faith
undefined After Jesus left there, he went to the region of Tyre. When he went into a house, he did not want anyone to know, but he was not able to escape notice.
undefined Instead, a woman whose young daughter had an unclean spirit immediately heard about him and came and fell at his feet.
undefined The woman was a Greek, of Syrophoenician origin. She asked him to cast the demon out of her daughter.
undefined He said to her, “Let the children be satisfied first, for it is not right to take the children’s bread and to throw it to the dogs.”
undefined She an-swered, “Yes, Lord, but even the dogs under the table eat the children’s crumbs.”
undefined Then he said to her, “Because you said this, you may go. The demon has left your daughter.”
undefined She went home and found the child lying on the bed, and the demon gone.Healing a Deaf Mute
undefined Then Jesus went out again from the region of Tyre and came through Sidon to the Sea of Galilee in the region of the Decapolis.
undefined They brought to him a deaf man who had difficulty speaking, and they asked him to place his hands on him.
undefined After Jesus took him aside privately, away from the crowd, he put his fingers in the man’s ears, and after spitting, he touched his tongue.
undefined Then he looked up to heaven and said with a sigh, “Ephphatha” (that is, “Be opened”).
undefined And immediately the man’s ears were opened, his tongue loosened, and he spoke plainly.
undefined Jesus ordered them not to tell anything. But as much as he ordered them not to do this, they proclaimed it all the more.
undefined People were completely astounded and said, “He has done everything well. He even makes the deaf hear and the mute speak.”The Feeding of the Four Thousand
In those days there was another large crowd with nothing to eat. So Jesus called his disciples and said to them,
undefined “I have com-passion on the crowd, because they have al-ready been here with me three days, and they have nothing to eat.
undefined If I send them home hungry, they will faint on the way, and some of them have come from a great distance.”
undefined His disciples answered him, “Where can someone get enough bread in this desolate place to satisfy these people?”
undefined He asked them, “How many loaves do you have?” They replied, “Seven.”

undefined Then he directed the crowd to sit down on the ground. After he took the seven loaves and gave thanks, he broke them and began giving them to the dis-ciples to serve. So they served the crowd.
undefined They also had a few small fish. After giving thanks for these, he told them to serve these as well.
undefined Everyone ate and was satisfied, and they picked up the broken pieces left over, seven baskets full.
undefined There were about four thousand who ate. Then he dismissed them.
undefined Immediately he got into a boat with his disciples and went to the district of Dalma-nutha.The Demand for a Sign
undefined Then the Pharisees came and began to argue with Jesus, asking for a sign from heav-en to test him.
undefined Sighing deeply in his spirit he said, “Why does this generation look for a sign? I tell you the truth, no sign will be given to this generation.”
undefined Then he left them, got back into the boat, and went to the other side.The Yeast of the Pharisees and Herod
undefined Now they had forgotten to take bread, except for one loaf they had with them in the boat.
undefined And Jesus ordered them, “Watch out! Beware of the yeast of the Phari-sees and the yeast of Herod!”
undefined So they began to discuss with one another about hav-ing no bread.
undefined When he learned of this, Jesus said to them, “Why are you arguing about having no bread? Do you still not see or understand? Have your hearts been hardened?
undefined Though you have eyes, don’t you see? And though you have ears, can’t you hear? Don’t you remember?
undefined When I broke the five loaves for the five thousand, how many baskets full of pieces did you pick up?” They replied, “Twelve.”
undefined “When I broke the seven loaves for the four thousand, how many baskets full of pieces did you pick up?” They replied, “Seven.”
undefined Then he said to them, “Do you still not understand?”A Two-stage Healing
undefined Then they came to Bethsaida. They brought a blind man to Jesus and asked him to touch him.
undefined He took the blind man by the hand and brought him outside of the village. Then he spit on his eyes, placed his hands on his eyes and asked, “Do you see anything?”
undefined Regaining his sight he said, “I see people, but they look like trees walking.”
undefined Then Jesus placed his hands on the man’s eyes again. And he opened his eyes, his sight was restored, and he saw everything clearly.
undefined Jesus sent him home, saying, “Do not even go into the village.”Peter’s Confession
undefined Then Jesus and his disciples went to the villages of Caesarea Philippi. On the way he asked his disciples, “Who do people say that I am?”
undefined They said, “John the Baptist, others say Elijah, and still others, one of the prophets.”
undefined He asked them, “But who do you say that I am?” Peter answered him, “You are the Christ.”
undefined Then he warned them not to tell anyone about him.First Prediction of Jesus’ Death and Resurrection

undefined Then Jesus began to teach them that the Son of Man must suffer many things and be rejected by the elders, chief priests, and experts in the law, and be killed, and after three days rise again.
undefined He spoke openly about this. So Peter took him aside and began to rebuke him.
undefined But after turning and look-ing at his disciples, he rebuked Peter and said, “Get behind me, Satan. You are not setting your mind on God’s interests, but on man’s.”Following Jesus
undefined Then Jesus called the crowd, along with his disciples, and said to them, “If any-one wants to become my follower, he must deny himself, take up his cross, and follow me.
undefined For whoever wants to save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for my sake and for the gospel will save it.
undefined For what benefit is it for a person to gain the whole world, yet forfeit his life?
undefined What can a person give in exchange for his life?

undefined For if anyone is ashamed of me and my words in this adulterous and sinful generation, the Son of Man will also be ashamed of him when he comes in the glory of his Father with the holy angels.”
And he said to them, “I tell you the truth, there are some standing here who will not experience death before they see the kingdom of God come with power.”The Transfiguration
undefined Six days later Jesus took with him Pe-ter, James, and John and led them alone up a high mountain privately. And he was transfig-ured before them,
undefined and his clothes became radiantly white, more so than any launderer in the world could bleach them.
undefined Then Elijah appeared before them along with Moses, and they were talking with Jesus.
undefined So Peter said to Jesus, “Rabbi, it is good for us to be here. Let us make three shelters – one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.”
undefined (For they were afraid, and he did not know what to say.)
undefined Then a cloud overshadowed them, and a voice came from the cloud, “This is my one dear Son. Listen to him!”
undefined Suddenly when they looked around, they saw no one with them any more except Jesus.
undefined As they were coming down from the mountain, he gave them orders not to tell any-one what they had seen until after the Son of Man had risen from the dead.
undefined They kept this statement to themselves, discussing what this rising from the dead meant.
undefined Then they asked him, “Why do the experts in the law say that Elijah must come first?”
undefined He said to them, “Elijah does in-deed come first, and restores all things. And why is it written that the Son of Man must suffer many things and be despised?
undefined But I tell you that Elijah has certainly come, and they did to him whatever they wanted, just as it is written about him.”The Disciples’ Failure to Heal
undefined When they came to the disciples, they saw a large crowd around them and experts in the law arguing with them.
undefined When the whole crowd saw him, they were amazed and ran at once and greeted him.
undefined He asked them, “What are you arguing about with them?”
undefined A member of the crowd said to him, “Teacher, I brought you my son, who is possessed by a spirit that makes him mute.
undefined Whenever it seizes him, it throws him down, and he foams at the mouth, grinds his teeth, and becomes rigid. I asked your disciples to cast it out, but they were not able to do so.”
undefined He answered them, “You unbelieving generation! How much longer must I be with you? How much longer must I endure you? Bring him to me.”
undefined So they brought the boy to him. When the spirit saw him, it imme-diately threw the boy into a convulsion. He fell on the ground and rolled around, foaming at the mouth.
undefined Jesus asked his father, “How long has this been happening to him?” And he said, “From childhood.
undefined It has often thrown him into fire or water to destroy him. But if you are able to do anything, have compassion on us and help us.”
undefined Then Je-sus said to him, “‘If you are able?’ All things are possible for the one who believes.”
undefined Immediately the father of the boy cried out and said, “I believe; help my unbelief!”
undefined Now when Jesus saw that a crowd was quickly gathering, he rebuked the unclean spirit, saying to it, “Mute and deaf spirit, I command you, come out of him and never enter him again.”
undefined It shrieked, threw him into terrible convulsions, and came out. The boy looked so much like a corpse that many said, “He is dead!”
undefined But Jesus gently took his hand and raised him to his feet, and he stood up.
undefined Then, after he went into the house, his disciples asked him privately, “Why couldn’t we cast it out?”
undefined He told them, “This kind can come out only by prayer.”Second Prediction of Jesus’ Death and Resurrection
undefined They went out from there and passed through Galilee. But Jesus did not want any-one to know,
undefined for he was teaching his dis-ciples and telling them, “The Son of Man will be betrayed into the hands of men. They will kill him, and after three days he will rise.”
undefined But they did not understand this statement and were afraid to ask him.Questions About the Greatest
undefined Then they came to Capernaum. After Jesus was inside the house he asked them, “What were you discussing on the way?”
undefined But they were silent, for on the way they had argued with one another about who was the greatest.
undefined After he sat down, he called the twelve and said to them, “If anyone wants to be first, he must be last of all and servant of all.”
undefined He took a little child and had him stand among them. Taking him in his arms, he said to them,
undefined “Whoever welcomes one of these little children in my name welcomes me, and whoever welcomes me does not welcome me but the one who sent me.”On Jesus’ Side
undefined John said to him, “Teacher, we saw someone casting out demons in your name, and we tried to stop him because he was not following us.”
undefined But Jesus said, “Do not stop him, because no one who does a miracle in my name will be able soon afterward to say anything bad about me.
undefined For whoever is not against us is for us.
undefined For I tell you the truth, whoever gives you a cup of water be-cause you bear Christ’s name will never lose his reward.
undefined “If anyone causes one of these little ones who believe in me to sin, it would be better for him to have a huge millstone tied around his neck and to be thrown into the sea.
undefined If your hand causes you to sin, cut it off! It is better for you to enter into life crippled than to have two hands and go into hell, to the unquenchable fire.
undefined If your foot causes you to sin, cut it off! It is better to enter life lame than to have two feet and be thrown into hell.
undefined If your eye causes you to sin, tear it out! It is better to enter into the kingdom of God with one eye than to have two eyes and be thrown into hell,
undefined where their worm never dies and the fire is never quenched.
undefined Eve-ryone will be salted with fire.
undefined Salt is good, but if it loses its saltiness, how can you make it salty again? Have salt in yourselves, and be at peace with each other.”
Then Jesus left that place and went to the region of Judea and beyond the Jordan River. Again crowds gathered to him, and again, as was his custom, he taught them.
undefined Then some Pharisees came, and to test him they asked, “Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife?”
undefined He answered them, “What did Moses command you?”
undefined They said, “Mo-ses permitted a man to write a certificate of dismissal and to divorce her.”
undefined But Jesus said to them, “He wrote this commandment for you because of your hard hearts.
undefined But from the beginning of creation he made them male and female.
undefined For this reason a man will leave his father and mother,
undefined and the two will become one flesh. So they are no longer two, but one flesh.
undefined Therefore what God has joined together, let no one separate.”
undefined In the house once again, the disciples asked him about this.
undefined So he told them, “Whoever divorces his wife and marries an-other commits adultery against her.
undefined And if she divorces her husband and marries anoth-er, she commits adultery.”Jesus and Little Children
undefined Now people were bringing little chil-dren to him for him to touch, but the disciples scolded those who brought them.
undefined But when Jesus saw this, he was indignant and said to them, “Let the little children come to me and do not try to stop them, for the king-dom of God belongs to such as these.
undefined I tell you the truth, whoever does not receive the kingdom of God like a child will never enter it.”
undefined After he took the children in his arms, he placed his hands on them and blessed them.The Rich Man
undefined Now as Jesus was starting out on his way, someone ran up to him, fell on his knees, and said, “Good teacher, what must I do to inherit eternal life?”
undefined Jesus said to him, “Why do you call me good? No one is good except God alone.
undefined You know the com-mandments: ‘Do not murder, do not commit adultery, do not steal, do not give false testi-mony, do not defraud, honor your father and mother.’”
undefined The man said to him, “Teach-er, I have wholeheartedly obeyed all these laws since my youth.”

undefined As Jesus looked at him, he felt love for him and said, “You lack one thing. Go, sell whatever you have and give the money to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come, follow me.”
undefined But at this statement, the man looked sad and went away sorrowful, for he was very rich.
undefined Then Jesus looked around and said to his disciples, “How hard it is for the rich to enter the kingdom of God!”
undefined The disci-ples were astonished at these words. But again Jesus said to them, “Children, how hard it is to enter the kingdom of God!
undefined It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich person to enter the kingdom of God.”
undefined They were even more astonished and said to one another, “Then who can be saved?”
undefined Jesus looked at them and re-plied, “This is impossible for mere humans, but not for God; all things are possible for God.”
undefined Peter began to speak to him, “Look, we have left everything to follow you!”
undefined Jesus said, “I tell you the truth, there is no one who has left home or brothers or sisters or mother or father or children or fields for my sake and for the sake of the gospel
undefined who will not receive in this age a hundred times as much – homes, brothers, sisters, mothers, chil-dren, fields, all with persecutions – and in the age to come, eternal life.
undefined But many who are first will be last, and the last first.”Third Prediction of Jesus’ Death and Resurrection

undefined They were on the way, going up to Jerusalem. Jesus was going ahead of them, and they were amazed, but those who followed were afraid. He took the twelve aside again and began to tell them what was going to hap-pen to him.

undefined “Look, we are going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be handed over to the chief priests and experts in the law. They will condemn him to death and will turn him over to the Gentiles.
undefined They will mock him, spit on him, flog him severely, and kill him. Yet after three days, he will rise again.”The Request of James and John
undefined Then James and John, the sons of Zebedee, came to him and said, “Teacher, we want you to do for us whatever we ask.”
undefined He said to them, “What do you want me to do for you?”
undefined They said to him, “Permit one of us to sit at your right hand and the other at your left in your glory.”
undefined But Jesus said to them, “You don’t know what you are asking! Are you able to drink the cup I drink or be baptized with the baptism I experience?”
undefined They said to him, “We are able.” Then Jesus said to them, “You will drink the cup I drink, and you will be baptized with the baptism I experience,
undefined but to sit at my right or at my left is not mine to give. It is for those for whom it has been prepared.”
undefined Now when the other ten heard this, they became angry with James and John.
undefined Jesus called them and said to them, “You know that those who are recognized as rulers of the Gentiles lord it over them, and those in high positions use their authority over them.
undefined But it is not this way among you. In-stead whoever wants to be great among you must be your servant,
undefined and whoever wants to be first among you must be the slave of all.
undefined For even the Son of Man did not come to be served but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.”Healing Blind Bartimaeus
undefined They came to Jericho. As Jesus and his disciples and a large crowd were leaving Jericho, Bartimaeus the son of Timaeus, a blind beggar, was sitting by the road.
undefined When he heard that it was Jesus the Nazarene, he began to shout, “Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!”
undefined Many scolded him to get him to be quiet, but he shouted all the more, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”
undefined Je-sus stopped and said, “Call him.” So they called the blind man and said to him, “Have courage! Get up! He is calling you.”
undefined He threw off his cloak, jumped up, and came to Jesus.
undefined Then Jesus said to him, “What do you want me to do for you?” The blind man replied, “Rabbi, let me see again.”
undefined Jesus said to him, “Go, your faith has healed you.” Immediately he regained his sight and fol-lowed him on the road.The Triumphal Entry
Now as they approached Jerusalem, near Bethphage and Bethany, at the Mount of Olives, Jesus sent two of his disciples
undefined and said to them, “Go to the village ahead of you. As soon as you enter it, you will find a colt tied there that has never been ridden. Untie it and bring it here.
undefined If anyone says to you, ‘Why are you doing this?’ say, ‘The Lord needs it and will send it back here soon.’”
undefined So they went and found a colt tied at a door, outside in the street, and untied it.
undefined Some people standing there said to them, “What are you doing, untying that colt?”
undefined They re-plied as Jesus had told them, and the bystand-ers let them go.
undefined Then they brought the colt to Jesus, threw their cloaks on it, and he sat on it.
undefined Many spread their cloaks on the road and others spread branches they had cut in the fields.
undefined Both those who went ahead and those who followed kept shouting, “Ho-sanna! Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord!
undefined Blessed is the coming kingdom of our father David! Hosanna in the highest!”
undefined Then Jesus entered Jerusalem and went to the temple. And after looking around at everything, he went out to Bethany with the twelve since it was already late.Cursing of the Fig Tree
undefined Now the next day, as they went out from Bethany, he was hungry.
undefined After noticing in the distance a fig tree with leaves, he went to see if he could find any fruit on it. When he came to it he found nothing but leaves, for it was not the season for figs.
undefined He said to it, “May no one ever eat fruit from you again.” And his disciples heard it.Cleansing the Temple

undefined Then they came to Jerusalem. Jesus entered the temple area and began to drive out those who were selling and buying in the tem-ple courts. He turned over the tables of the money changers and the chairs of those selling doves,
undefined and he would not permit anyone to carry merchandise through the temple courts.
undefined Then he began to teach them and said, “Is it not written: ‘My house will be called a house of prayer for all nations’? But you have turned it into a den of robbers!”
undefined The chief priests and the experts in the law heard it and they considered how they could assassinate him, for they feared him, because the whole crowd was amazed by his teaching.
undefined When evening came, Jesus and his disciples went out of the city.The Withered Fig Tree
undefined In the morning as they passed by, they saw the fig tree withered from the roots.
undefined Peter remembered and said to him, “Rabbi, look! The fig tree you cursed has withered.”
undefined Jesus said to them, “Have faith in God.

undefined I tell you the truth, if someone says to this mountain, ‘Be lifted up and thrown into the sea,’ and does not doubt in his heart but believes that what he says will happen, it will be done for him.
undefined For this reason I tell you, whatever you pray and ask for, believe that you have received it, and it will be yours.
undefined Whenever you stand pray-ing, if you have anything against anyone, for-give him, so that your Father in heaven will also forgive you your sins.”The Authority of Jesus
undefined They came again to Jerusalem. While Jesus was walking in the temple courts, the chief priests, the experts in the law, and the elders came up to him
undefined and said, “By what authority are you doing these things? Or who gave you this authority to do these things?”
undefined Jesus said to them, “I will ask you one question. Answer me and I will tell you by what authority I do these things:
undefined John’s baptism – was it from heaven or from people? Answer me.”
undefined They discussed with one another, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will say, ‘Then why did you not believe him?’
undefined But if we say, ‘From peo-ple – ’” (they feared the crowd, for they all considered John to be truly a prophet).
undefined So they answered Jesus, “We don’t know.” Then Jesus said to them, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I am doing these things.”The Parable of the Tenants

Then he began to speak to them in parables: “A man planted a vineyard. He put a fence around it, dug a pit for its winepress, and built a watchtower. Then he leased it to tenant farmers and went on a journey.
undefined At harvest time he sent a slave to the tenants to collect from them his portion of the crop.
undefined But those tenants seized his slave, beat him, and sent him away empty-handed.
undefined So he sent another slave to them again. This one they struck on the head and treated outrageously.
undefined He sent another, and that one they killed. This happened to many others, some of whom were beaten, others killed.
undefined He had one left, his one dear son. Finally he sent him to them, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’
undefined But those tenants said to one another, ‘This is the heir. Come, let’s kill him and the inher-itance will be ours!’
undefined So they seized him, killed him, and threw his body out of the vineyard.
undefined What then will the owner of the vineyard do? He will come and destroy those tenants and give the vineyard to others.
undefined Have you not read this scripture:‘The stone the builders rejected has become the cornerstone.
undefined This is from the Lord, and it is marvelous in our eyes’?”
undefined Now they wanted to arrest him (but they feared the crowd), because they realized that he told this parable against them. So they left him and went away.Paying Taxes to Caesar
undefined Then they sent some of the Pharisees and Herodians to trap him with his own words.

undefined When they came they said to him, “Teacher, we know that you are truthful and do not court anyone’s favor, because you show no partiality but teach the way of God in accordance with the truth. Is it right to pay taxes to Caesar or not? Should we pay or shouldn’t we?”
undefined But he saw through their hypocrisy and said to them, “Why are you testing me? Bring me a denarius and let me look at it.”
undefined So they brought one, and he said to them, “Whose image is this, and whose inscription?” They replied, “Caesar’s.”
undefined Then Jesus said to them, “Give to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.” And they were utterly amazed at him.Marriage and the Resurrection
undefined Sadducees (who say there is no res-urrection) also came to him and asked him,
undefined “Teacher, Moses wrote for us: ‘If a man’s brother dies and leaves a wife but no children, that man must marry the widow and father children for his brother.’
undefined There were seven brothers. The first one married, and when he died he had no children.
undefined The second married her and died without any chil-dren, and likewise the third.
undefined None of the seven had children. Finally, the woman died too.
undefined In the resurrection, when they rise again, whose wife will she be? For all seven had married her.”
undefined Jesus said to them, “Aren’t you deceived for this reason, because you don’t know the scriptures or the power of God?
undefined For when they rise from the dead, they neither marry nor are given in marriage, but are like angels in heaven.

undefined Now as for the dead being raised, have you not read in the book of Moses, in the passage about the bush, how God said to him, ‘I am the God of Abra-ham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Ja-cob’?
undefined He is not the God of the dead but of the living. You are badly mistaken!”The Greatest Commandment
undefined Now one of the experts in the law came and heard them debating. When he saw that Jesus answered them well, he asked him, “Which commandment is the most important of all?”
undefined Jesus answered, “The most im-portant is: ‘Listen, Israel, the Lord our God, the Lord is one.
undefined Love the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your soul, with all your mind, and with all your strength.’
undefined The second is: ‘Love your neighbor as your-self.’ There is no other commandment greater than these.”
undefined The expert in the law said to him, “That is true, Teacher; you are right to say that he is one, and there is no one else besides him.
undefined And to love him with all your heart, with all your mind, and with all your strength and to love your neighbor as yourself is more important than all burnt offerings and sacrifices.”
undefined When Jesus saw that he had answered thoughtfully, he said to him, “You are not far from the kingdom of God.” Then no one dared any longer to question him.The Messiah: David’s Son and Lord
undefined While Jesus was teaching in the tem-ple courts, he said, “How is it that the experts in the law say that the Christ is David’s son?
undefined David himself, by the Holy Spirit, said,‘The Lord said to my lord,“Sit at my right hand,until I put your enemies under your feet.”’
undefined If David himself calls him ‘Lord,’ how can he be his son?” And the large crowd was listening to him with delight. Warnings About Experts in the Law
undefined In his teaching Jesus also said, “Watch out for the experts in the law. They like walking around in long robes and elabo-rate greetings in the marketplaces,
undefined and the best seats in the synagogues and the places of honor at banquets.
undefined They devour wid-ows’ property, and as a show make long pray-ers. These men will receive a more severe pun-ishment.”The Widow’s Offering
undefined Then he sat down opposite the offer-ing box, and watched the crowd putting coins into it. Many rich people were throwing in large amounts.
undefined And a poor widow came and put in two small copper coins, worth less than a penny.
undefined He called his disciples and said to them, “I tell you the truth, this poor widow has put more into the offering box than all the others.
undefined For they all gave out of their wealth. But she, out of her poverty, put in what she had to live on, everything she had.”The Destruction of the Temple
Now as Jesus was going out of the temple courts, one of his disciples said to him, “Teacher, look at these tremendous stones and buildings!”
undefined Jesus said to him, “Do you see these great buildings? Not one stone will be left on another. All will be torn down!”Signs of the End of the Age
undefined So while he was sitting on the Mount of Olives opposite the temple, Peter, James, John, and Andrew asked him privately,
undefined “Tell us, when will these things happen? And what will be the sign that all these things are about to take place?”
undefined Jesus began to say to them, “Watch out that no one misleads you.
undefined Many will come in my name, saying, ‘I am he,’ and they will mislead many.
undefined When you hear of wars and rumors of wars, do not be alarmed. These things must happen, but the end is still to come.

undefined For nation will rise up in arms against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. There will be earthquakes in various places, and there will be famines. These are but the beginning of birth pains.Persecution of Disciples
undefined “You must watch out for yourselves. You will be handed over to councils and beat-en in the synagogues. You will stand before governors and kings because of me, as a wit-ness to them.
undefined First the gospel must be preached to all nations.
undefined When they arrest you and hand you over for trial, do not worry about what to speak. But say whatever is giv-en you at that time, for it is not you speaking, but the Holy Spirit.
undefined Brother will hand over brother to death, and a father his child. Children will rise against parents and have them put to death.
undefined You will be hated by everyone because of my name. But the one who endures to the end will be saved. The Abomination of Desolation
undefined “But when you see the abomination of desolation standing where it should not be (let the reader understand), then those in Judea must flee to the mountains.
undefined The one on the roof must not come down or go inside to take anything out of his house.
undefined The one in the field must not turn back to get his cloak.
undefined Woe to those who are pregnant and to those who are nursing their babies in those days!
undefined Pray that it may not be in winter.
undefined For in those days there will be suffering unlike anything that has happened from the beginning of the creation that God created until now, or ever will happen.
undefined And if the Lord had not cut short those days, no one would be saved. But because of the elect, whom he chose, he has cut them short.
undefined Then if anyone says to you, ‘Look, here is the Christ!’ or ‘Look, there he is!’ do not believe him.
undefined For false messiahs and false proph-ets will appear and perform signs and wonders to deceive, if possible, the elect.
undefined Be care-ful! I have told you everything ahead of time.The Arrival of the Son of Man
undefined “But in those days, after that suffer-ing, the sun will be darkened and the moon will not give its light;
undefined the stars will be falling from heaven, and the powers in the heavens will be shaken.
undefined Then everyone will see the Son of Man arriving in the clouds with great power and glory.
undefined Then he will send angels and they will gather his elect from the four winds, from the ends of the earth to the ends of heaven.The Parable of the Fig Tree
undefined “Learn this parable from the fig tree: Whenever its branch becomes tender and puts out its leaves, you know that summer is near.
undefined So also you, when you see these things happening, know that he is near, right at the door.
undefined I tell you the truth, this generation will not pass away until all these things take place.
undefined Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will never pass away.Be Ready!
undefined “But as for that day or hour no one knows it – neither the angels in heaven, nor the Son – except the Father.
undefined Watch out! Stay alert! For you do not know when the time will come.
undefined It is like a man going on a journey. He left his house and put his slaves in charge, assigning to each his work, and com-manded the doorkeeper to stay alert.
undefined Stay alert, then, because you do not know when the owner of the house will return – whether during evening, at midnight, when the rooster crows, or at dawn –
undefined or else he might find you asleep when he returns sudden-ly.
undefined What I say to you I say to everyone: Stay alert!”The Plot Against Jesus
Two days before the Passover and the Feast of Unleavened Bread, the chief priests and the experts in the law were trying to find a way to arrest Jesus by stealth and kill him.
undefined For they said, “Not during the feast, so there won’t be a riot among the people.”Jesus’ Anointing

undefined Now while Jesus was in Bethany at the house of Simon the leper, reclining at the table, a woman came with an alabaster jar of costly aromatic oil from pure nard. After breaking open the jar, she poured it on his head.
undefined But some who were present indig-nantly said to one another, “Why this waste of expensive ointment?
undefined It could have been sold for more than three hundred silver coins and the money given to the poor!” So they spoke angrily to her.
undefined But Jesus said, “Leave her alone. Why are you bothering her? She has done a good service for me.
undefined For you will always have the poor with you, and you can do good for them whenever you want. But you will not always have me!
undefined She did what she could. She anointed my body be-forehand for burial.
undefined I tell you the truth, wherever the gospel is proclaimed in the whole world, what she has done will also be told in memory of her.”The Plan to Betray Jesus
undefined Then Judas Iscariot, one of the twelve, went to the chief priests to betray Je-sus into their hands.
undefined When they heard this, they were delighted and promised to give him money. So Judas began looking for an opportunity to betray him.The Passover
undefined Now on the first day of the feast of Unleavened Bread, when the Passover lamb is sacrificed, Jesus’ disciples said to him, “Where do you want us to prepare for you to eat the Passover?”
undefined He sent two of his disciples and told them, “Go into the city, and a man carrying a jar of water will meet you. Follow him.
undefined Wherever he enters, tell the owner of the house, ‘The Teacher says, “Where is my guest room where I may eat the Passover with my disciples?”’
undefined He will show you a large room upstairs, furnished and ready. Make preparations for us there.”
undefined So the disci-ples left, went into the city, and found things just as he had told them, and they prepared the Passover.
undefined Then, when it was evening, he came to the house with the twelve.
undefined While they were at the table eating, Jesus said, “I tell you the truth, one of you eating with me will be-tray me.”
undefined They were distressed, and one by one said to him, “Surely not I?”
undefined He said to them, “It is one of the twelve, one who dips his hand with me into the bowl.
undefined For the Son of Man will go as it is written about him, but woe to that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It would be better for him if he had never been born.”The Lord’s Supper
undefined While they were eating, he took bread, and after giving thanks he broke it, gave it to them, and said, “Take it. This is my body.”
undefined And after taking the cup and giving thanks, he gave it to them, and they all drank from it.
undefined He said to them, “This is my blood, the blood of the covenant, that is poured out for many.
undefined I tell you the truth, I will no longer drink of the fruit of the vine until that day when I drink it new in the king-dom of God.”
undefined After singing a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.The Prediction of Peter’s Denial
undefined Then Jesus said to them, “You will all fall away, for it is written,‘I will strike the shepherd,and the sheep will be scattered.’
undefined But after I am raised, I will go ahead of you into Galilee.”
undefined Peter said to him, “Even if they all fall away, I will not!”
undefined Jesus said to him, “I tell you the truth, today – this very night – before a rooster crows twice, you will deny me three times.”
undefined But Peter insisted emphatically, “Even if I must die with you, I will never deny you.” And all of them said the same thing.Gethsemane
undefined Then they went to a place called Gethsemane, and Jesus said to his disciples, “Sit here while I pray.”
undefined He took Peter, James, and John with him, and became very troubled and distressed.
undefined He said to them, “My soul is deeply grieved, even to the point of death. Remain here and stay alert.”
undefined Going a little farther, he threw himself to the ground and prayed that if it were possible the hour would pass from him.
undefined He said, “Abba, Father, all things are possible for you. Take this cup away from me. Yet not what I will, but what you will.”
undefined Then he came and found them sleeping, and said to Peter, “Simon, are you sleeping? Couldn’t you stay awake for one hour?
undefined Stay awake and pray that you will not fall into temptation. The spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak.”
undefined He went away again and prayed the same thing.
undefined When he came again he found them sleeping; they could not keep their eyes open. And they did not know what to tell him.
undefined He came a third time and said to them, “Are you still sleeping and resting? Enough of that! The hour has come. Look, the Son of Man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.
undefined Get up, let us go. Look! My betrayer is approaching!”Betrayal and Arrest

undefined Right away, while Jesus was still speaking, Judas, one of the twelve, arrived. With him came a crowd armed with swords and clubs, sent by the chief priests and experts in the law and elders.
undefined (Now the betrayer had given them a sign, saying, “The one I kiss is the man. Arrest him and lead him away un-der guard.”)
undefined When Judas arrived, he went up to Jesus immediately and said, “Rab-bi!” and kissed him.
undefined Then they took hold of him and arrested him.
undefined One of the by-standers drew his sword and struck the high priest’s slave, cutting off his ear.
undefined Jesus said to them, “Have you come with swords and clubs to arrest me like you would an out-law?
undefined Day after day I was with you, teaching in the temple courts, yet you did not arrest me. But this has happened so that the scriptures would be fulfilled.”
undefined Then all the disciples left him and fled.
undefined A young man was following him, wearing only a linen cloth. They tried to arrest him,
undefined but he ran off naked, leaving his linen cloth behind.Condemned by the Sanhedrin
undefined Then they led Jesus to the high priest, and all the chief priests and elders and experts in the law came together.
undefined And Peter had followed him from a distance, up to the high priest’s courtyard. He was sitting with the guards and warming himself by the fire.
undefined The chief priests and the whole Sanhed-rin were looking for evidence against Jesus so that they could put him to death, but they did not find anything.
undefined Many gave false tes-timony against him, but their testimony did not agree.
undefined Some stood up and gave this false testimony against him:
undefined “We heard him say, ‘I will destroy this temple made with hands and in three days build another not made with hands.’”
undefined Yet even on this point their testimony did not agree.
undefined Then the high priest stood up before them and asked Jesus, “Have you no answer? What is this that they are testifying against you?”
undefined But he was silent and did not answer. Again the high priest questioned him, “Are you the Christ, the Son of the Blessed One?”
undefined “I am,” said Jesus, “and you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of the Power and coming with the clouds of heaven.”
undefined Then the high priest tore his clothes and said, “Why do we still need witnesses?
undefined You have heard the blasphemy! What is your verdict?” They all condemned him as deserving death.
undefined Then some began to spit on him, and to blind-fold him, and to strike him with their fists, saying, “Prophesy!” The guards also took him and beat him.Peter’s Denials
undefined Now while Peter was below in the courtyard, one of the high priest’s slave girls came by.
undefined When she saw Peter warming himself, she looked directly at him and said, “You also were with that Nazarene, Jesus.”
undefined But he denied it: “I don’t even under-stand what you’re talking about!” Then he went out to the gateway, and a rooster crowed.
undefined When the slave girl saw him, she began again to say to the bystanders, “This man is one of them.”
undefined But he denied it again. A short time later the bystanders again said to Peter, “You must be one of them, be-cause you are also a Galilean.”
undefined Then he began to curse, and he swore with an oath, “I do not know this man you are talking about!”

undefined Immediately a rooster crowed a second time. Then Peter remembered what Jesus had said to him: “Before a rooster crows twice, you will deny me three times.” And he broke down and wept.Jesus Brought Before Pilate
Early in the morning, after forming a plan, the chief priests with the elders and the experts in the law and the whole Sanhedrin tied Jesus up, led him away, and handed him over to Pilate.
undefined So Pilate asked him, “Are you the king of the Jews?” He replied, “You say so.”
undefined Then the chief priests began to accuse him repeatedly.
undefined So Pilate asked him again, “Have you nothing to say? See how many charges they are bringing against you!”
undefined But Jesus made no further reply, so that Pilate was amazed. Jesus and Barabbas
undefined During the feast it was customary to release one prisoner to the people, whomever they requested.
undefined A man named Barabbas was imprisoned with rebels who had commit-ted murder during an insurrection.
undefined Then the crowd came up and began to ask Pilate to release a prisoner for them, as was his custom.
undefined So Pilate asked them, “Do you want me to release the king of the Jews for you?”
undefined (For he knew that the chief priests had handed him over because of envy.)
undefined But the chief priests stirred up the crowd to have him release Barabbas instead.
undefined So Pilate spoke to them again, “Then what do you want me to do with the one you call king of the Jews?”
undefined They shouted back, “Crucify him!”
undefined Pi-late asked them, “Why? What has he done wrong?” But they shouted more insistently, “Crucify him!”
undefined Because he wanted to satisfy the crowd, Pilate released Barabbas for them. Then, after he had Jesus flogged, he handed him over to be crucified.Jesus is Mocked
undefined So the soldiers led him into the pal-ace (that is, the governor’s residence) and called together the whole cohort.
undefined They put a purple cloak on him and after braiding a crown of thorns, they put it on him.
undefined They began to salute him: “Hail, king of the Jews!”
undefined Again and again they struck him on the head with a staff and spit on him. Then they knelt down and paid homage to him.
undefined When they had finished mocking him, they stripped him of the purple cloak and put his own clothes back on him. Then they led him away to crucify him.The Crucifixion
undefined The soldiers forced a passerby to car-ry his cross, Simon of Cyrene, who was com-ing in from the country (he was the father of Alexander and Rufus).
undefined They brought Jesus to a place called Golgotha (which is translated, “Place of the Skull”).
undefined They offered him wine mixed with myrrh, but he did not take it.
undefined Then they crucified him and divided his clothes, throwing dice for them, to decide what each would take.
undefined It was nine o’clock in the morning when they crucified him.
undefined The inscription of the charge against him read, “The king of the Jews.”
undefined And they crucified two outlaws with him, one on his right and one on his left.
undefined Those who passed by defamed him, shaking their heads and saying, “Aha! You who can destroy the temple and rebuild it in three days,
undefined save yourself and come down from the cross!”
undefined In the same way even the chief priests – together with the ex-perts in the law – were mocking him among themselves: “He saved others, but he cannot save himself!
undefined Let the Christ, the king of Israel, come down from the cross now, that we may see and believe!” Those who were cruci-fied with him also spoke abusively to him.Jesus’ Death
undefined Now when it was noon, darkness came over the whole land until three in the afternoon.
undefined Around three o’clock Jesus cried out with a loud voice, “Eloi, Eloi, lema sabachthani?” which means, “My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?”
undefined When some of the bystanders heard it they said, “Listen, he is calling for Elijah!”
undefined Then someone ran, filled a sponge with sour wine, put it on a stick, and gave it to him to drink, saying, “Leave him alone! Let’s see if Elijah will come to take him down!”
undefined But Jesus cried out with a loud voice and breathed his last.
undefined And the temple curtain was torn in two, from top to bottom.
undefined Now when the centurion, who stood in front of him, saw how he died, he said, “Truly this man was God’s Son!”
undefined There were also women, watching from a distance. Among them were Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James the younger and of Joses, and Salome.
undefined When he was in Galilee, they had fol-lowed him and given him support. Many other women who had come up with him to Jerusa-lem were there too.Jesus’ Burial
undefined Now when evening had already come, since it was the day of preparation (that is, the day before the Sabbath),
undefined Joseph of Arimathea, a highly regarded member of the council, who was himself looking forward to the kingdom of God, went boldly to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus.
undefined Pilate was surprised that he was already dead. He called the centurion and asked him if he had been dead for some time.
undefined When Pilate was informed by the centurion, he gave the body to Joseph.
undefined After Joseph bought a linen cloth and took down the body, he wrapped it in the linen and placed it in a tomb cut out of the rock. Then he rolled a stone across the entrance of the tomb.
undefined Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses saw where the body was placed.The Resurrection
When the Sabbath was over, Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James, and Salome bought aromatic spices so that they might go and anoint him.
undefined And very early on the first day of the week, at sunrise, they went to the tomb.
undefined They had been asking each other, “Who will roll away the stone for us from the entrance to the tomb?”
undefined But when they looked up, they saw that the stone, which was very large, had been rolled back.
undefined Then as they went into the tomb, they saw a young man dressed in a white robe sit-ting on the right side; and they were alarmed.
undefined But he said to them, “Do not be alarmed. You are looking for Jesus the Nazarene, who was crucified. He has been raised! He is not here. Look, there is the place where they laid him.
undefined But go, tell his disciples, even Peter, that he is going ahead of you into Galilee. You will see him there, just as he told you.”
undefined Then they went out and ran from the tomb, for terror and bewilderment had seized them. And they said nothing to anyone, because they were afraid.The Longer Ending of Mark	[[
undefined Early on the first day of the week, after he arose, he appeared first to Mary Magdalene, from whom he had driven out seven demons.
undefined She went out and told those who were with him, while they were mourning and weeping.
undefined And when they heard that he was alive and had been seen by her, they did not believe.
undefined After this he appeared in a different form to two of them while they were on their way to the coun-try.
undefined They went back and told the rest, but they did not believe them.

undefined Then he appeared to the eleven themselves, while they were eating, and he re-buked them for their unbelief and hardness of heart, because they did not believe those who had seen him resurrected.
undefined He said to them, “Go into all the world and preach the gospel to every creature.
undefined The one who believes and is baptized will be saved, but the one who does not believe will be condemned.
undefined These signs will ac-company those who believe: In my name they will drive out demons; they will speak in new languages;
undefined they will pick up snakes with their hands, and whatever poison they drink will not harm them; they will place their hands on the sick and they will be well.”
undefined After the Lord Jesus had spoken to them, he was taken up into heaven and sat down at the right hand of God.
undefined They went out and proclaimed everywhere, while the Lord worked with them and confirmed the word through the accompanying signs.]]
